department.ch: 產業經濟研究所碩士班

goal.en: This course introduces students to the application of game theory in two settings, which are (i) the management of common pool resources, and (ii) the optimal design of auctions.
goal.ch: This course introduces students to the application of game theory in two settings, which are (i) the management of common pool resources, and (ii) the optimal design of auctions.

content.en: Students are expected to understand the game-theoretic approach to the management of common pool resources and appreciate the various formats of contemporary auctions, being acquainted with the necessary tools to strategize bidding behavior and solve policy problems.
content.ch: Students are expected to understand the game-theoretic approach to the management of common pool resources and appreciate the various formats of contemporary auctions, being acquainted with the necessary tools to strategize bidding behavior and solve policy problems.

textbook.en: Required 1. Espínola-Arredondo, A. ＆ Muñoz-García, F. (2021). Common Pool Resources: Strategic Behavior, Inefficiencies, and Incomplete Information. Cambridge University Press. Recommended 2. Milgrom, P. (2004). Putting Auction Theory to Work. Cambridge University Press. 3. Krishna, V. (2009). Auction Theory, 2nd Edition. Academic Press. 4. Menezes, F.M. ＆ Monteiro, P.K. (2008). An Introduction to Auction Theory. Oxford University Press. 5. Choi, P. ＆ Muñoz-García, F. (2021). Auction Theory: Introductory Exercises with Answer Keys. Springer Nature. 6. Klemperer, P. (2004). Auctions: Theory and Practice. Princeton University Press. 7. Campbell, D. (2006). Incentives, Motivation and Economics of Information, 2nd Edition. Cambridge University Press. 8. Roth, A.
